page.title: 05ROTHER VALLEY PARK IN WALES
page.content: Rother Valley Country Park is very large, covering 287 hectares of land which was previously open-cast coal mining land.It opened in 1983 and there is something to suit everyone. In the park there are four lakes. Rother Valley lake is used for water sports,canoeing,wind surfing, etc.It is over 2km long and contains 1,000 megalitres of water.There is a fishing lake and a model boating lake too.The Meadowgate lake is a nature reserve. with many tree planting areas nearby. Over 300,000 different trees have been planted in the park already. Behind the car park there are some picnic areas and children's adventure playgrounds.There is a cafe, beside which is the historic Bedgreave mill. It doesn't work now but is used as a museum and visitor's centre.There is a video about the Park's development.
